resources.string: Application written in Kotlin and C++ and uses injector codebase from the NXLoader application. It is used to install payloads on the Nintendo Switch

First you need to find a cable to connect your device to the Nintendo Switch. For proper work, this should be a cable that is designed for data transmission, not just for charging.\n\nIt is advisable to use an A-to-C cable and an USB OTG adapter.

In the \u0022Payloads\u0022 category, click the \u0022+\u0022 button to select preloaded payload from your device\'s storage. Or simply transfer your payload to the Rekado folder in the device\'s memory.\n\nOr you can use the default payload (SX Loader)
Enter your Nintendo Switch into RCM mode in any convenient way. \n\nYour Nintendo Switch will power on by itself when plugged in, be sure to hold VOLUME +.
Connect the device to the Nintendo Switch and allow permission for the USB access if necessary. Wait until the program prompts you to select payload and choose the one you need.
Rekado need this permission to get payload files from your device\'s storage.
